lg.l:
Modir of lyf O cause of al our welthe <\l>
Fyndere of grace and of our medecyne <\l>
Whereas an appil refte our lyf and helthe <\l>
And marie vs vnto ay lastyng pyne <\l>
As sones of perdicion and ruyne <\l>
That matrymoyne thy virginitee <\l>
Dissolved and vnbownden hath, virgyne <\l> <\lg>
And at our large maad vs walke free <\l>
O blessid be thow vessel of clennesse <\l>
In whom our soules salue list habyte <\l>
O tree of lyf swettest of al swetnesse <\l>
In thy fruyt yeue vs grace to delyte <\l>
And thogh thy sone cause have vs to smyte <\l>
For our giltes, yit our mediatrice <\l> <\lg>
As thow hast evere doon, thow him excite <\l>
Vnto mercy for that is thyn office <\l>
My soule is stuffid so with stynk of synne <\l>
That ay it dreedith beforn thee appeere <\l>
Lest for the filthe which that it is ynne <\l>
Thow torne away thy merciable cheere <\l>
And deyne nat accepte my preyeere <\l> <\lg>
And if my trespas heere I nat confesse <\l>
How shal I doon, O Crystes modir deere <\l>
Whan God shal juge vs alle more and lesse <\l>
O why my synnes why my wikkidnesses <\l>
With your venym my soule slayn han yee <\l>
And put in it so desperat gastnesses <\l>
That mercy may ne list beholde me <\l> <\lg>
Why oppressith your heuy aduersitee <\l>
The hope of myn exaudicioun <\l>
And shame in yow maad hath so large entree <\l>
That yee the vois me reue of orisoun <\l>
Allas thy shame O thow filthy offense <\l>
In the presence of shynynge holynesse <\l>
O shenshipe of vnclene conscience <\l> <\lg>
In the beholdynge of pured clennesse <\l>
O caitif soule inuolued in dirknesse <\l>
What wilt thow do, where is thy remedie <\l>
Who may thy mescheef and thy greef redresse <\l>
Syn of thy gilt thow darst nat mercy crie <\l>
Lo blessid womman among wommen alle <\l>
Syn my spirit nat dar putte vp his bille <\l> <\lg>
Thy grace ne thy mercy forto to calle <\l>
But in his mazidnesse abydith stille <\l>
My thristy soule drynke may hir fille <\l>
Of sorwe and bathe in sorwe and heuynesse <\l>
Hir ferdful shame hir shende wole and spille <\l>
For to hire helthe nat shee dar hir dresse <\l>
My synnes yernen that thyn hy pitee <\l> <\lg>
Fully hem kneew for hir curacioun <\l>
But they lothen appeere beforn thee <\l>
For hir cursid abhominacion <\l>
O spryng and welle of our sauuacioun <\l>
My dirke soule of thy grace enlumyne <\l>
And keepe it fro the castigacioun <\l>
That it disserved hath in helle pyne <\l> <\lg>
If I confesse myn iniquitee <\l>
Lady that I wroght have in thy presence <\l>
Wilt thow me werne thy benignitee <\l>
If that my gilt and my dampnable offense <\l>
Of giltes alle have an excellence <\l>
Shal thy mercy be lesse than it oghte <\l>
May nat thy mercy with my gilt dispense <\l> <\lg>
And pardoun gete of that that it miswroghte <\l>
The more that my gilt passith mesure <\l>
And stynkith in thy sones sighte and thyn <\l>
The gretter neede hath it of his cure <\l>
And of thyn help, wherfore lady myn <\l>
My soule fro the net and fro thengyn <\l>
Of him that waytith it to slee thow keepe <\l> <\lg>
His sotil snares and cacchynge twyn <\l>
In my memorie ficchid been ful deepe <\l>
Lady thyn help nat wole I me despeire <\l>
For in myn herte fully I conceyve <\l>
That thow to heuene art the laddre and steire <\l>
By which men clymben blisse to receyue <\l>
Despeir heereaftir shal me nat deceyve <\l> <\lg>
That I ne shal ay thee byseeche of grace <\l>
Thy might I woot wel is my gilt to weyue <\l>
And of my trespas pardoun me purchace <\l>
Thow Crystes modir sholdest neuere han be <\l>
Ne had our synnes causid it certayn <\l>
Forwhy it had be no necessitee <\l>
But for thow qwikne shuldest vs agayn <\l> <\lg>
That for our gilt original wern slayn <\l>
Thow art his modir wherfore I thee preye <\l>
To saue me have thow no desdayn <\l>
That of bountee and mercy art the keye <\l>
Evene as the moone a mene is verraily <\l>
Betwixt vs and the sonne of whom hir light <\l>
Shee takith and it vniuerselly <\l> <\lg>
Yeueth vnto the world whan it is nyght <\l>
In swich a wyse God, thy sone right <\l>
The light of grace betook vnto thee <\l>
Forto to mynistre it vnto every wight <\l>
That thereof list enlumyned to be <\l>
Thyn humble goost and maydens chastitee <\l>
For our behoue han so mochil wroght <\l> <\lg>
In sundry wyse as that wel knowen we <\l>
That thee to thanke we souffyse noght <\l>
Thow hast vs vnto swich a plyt Ibroght <\l>
That he that lord was sumtyme of vengeance <\l>
With his blood hath our synful soules boght <\l>
And is now lord of mercy and souffrance <\l>
Where is a streighter way vnto mankynde <\l> <\lg>
To God, thy sone our soules forto to lede <\l>
Than whereas that we may thy sone fynde <\l>
Beforn his fadir with his wowndes rede <\l>
And the before hem, mercy forto to grede <\l>
Thy sone his body shewith al bybled <\l>
And to thy sone also thy maydenhede <\l>
Shewith the pappes wherwith he was fed <\l> <\lg>
O blessid Jhesu for thy modres love <\l>
And modir for the hy dileccion <\l>
That thow hast to thy sone in heuene aboue <\l>
Haveth me bothe in your proteccion <\l>
Plante in myn herte swich correccion <\l>
That I your grace and your mercy may have <\l>
And fully stande in youre affeccion <\l> <\lg>
Or my body be clothid in his grave <\l> <\lg>
<\l>
That I your grace and your mercy may have <\l> <\poem>
